page.title: 03KIMBERLY-CLARK LTD. PRUDHOE
page.content: Kimberly-Clark Limited was opened on the 29th of November 1971. The factory was built for production of: Kitchen towels, handkerchieves, medical wipes, tampons, feminine towels, toilet tissues, etc. It was opened by Princess Anne. When the factory opened the managing director of Kimberly-Clark was Derek Croxon. It cost over Â£10 million to build and has brought 946 people jobs (140-150 of them are for women). It took over 2 years to develop the 53 acres site on the banks of the River Tyne, demolishing old chemical works and building the most modern paper tissue mill in Europe in it's place. Prudhoe was selected for 4 reasons: Plentiful water, adequate land, good communications and workforce. The average wages for 3 shift workers=Â£550 and for 4 shift workers=Â£700 a month.
